articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: AS a veteran of way too many Hampden and Wembley skirmishes – and I’ve got the scars to prove it – I am looking forward to Tuesday’s 150th anniversary match between Scotland and England at “Celtic’s second home,” as Bertie Auld used to call our national stadium. Contrary to popular belief, I was not among [...]
articles.title: ALEX’S ANGLE: ‘NO BAD FOR AN EFFIN’ LINSEMAN, EH, WALTER?’

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CQN is turning the spotlight once again on the Celtic players who never had the honour of playing for their country. Goalkeeper John Fallon played an important part in Celtic winning the Scottish Cup when they overcame Dunfermline 3-2 in April 1965 – the club’s first silverware in eight years. He was in Jock Stein’s [...]
articles.title: JOHN FALLON: GREAT UNCAPPED CELTS (Part Five)

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Uefa’s new funding distribution model, announced yesterday, is a bit of a mixed bag for Celtic.  Payments for performance in the Champions League increase, which is a nod to clubs from the big leagues, who always perform better.  This will be partly paid for by a reduction in distribution from the TV Pot, currently a [...]
articles.title: Uefa funding, haves and have nots

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: JOE HART will be the man in possession of the gloves when Celtic embark on another Champions League quest. The 36-year-old 75 times-capped England international keeper has surely answered his critics with his recent displays, particularly his sound and near-flawless performance in the 1-0 win at Ibrox on Sunday. The shotstopper utilised all his experience to [...]
articles.title: HAIL THE HART STOPPER

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: LISBON LION Bobby Lennox scored TEN goals in two games within two weeks in 1968. That’s one more strike than Albian Ajeti managed in TWO years at the Parkhead club. The expensive Swiss misfit, reportedly on £25,000-per-week, eventually left the Hoops this week with the tag of being one of the worst purchases in the club’s history. Ajeti [...]
articles.title: BOBBY LENNOX 10 ALBIAN AJETI 9

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CQN is turning the spotlight once again on the Celtic players who never had the honour of playing for their country. Roddie MacDonald became a trusted centre-half for Jock Stein as he searched for a long-term replacement for club icon Billy McNeill. However, the towering Highlander was never deemed good enough to get into a Scotland [...]
articles.title: RODDIE MacDONALD: GREAT UNCAPPED CELTS (Part Four)

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Matt O’Riley had recently turned 21 when he joined Celtic from MK Dons in January 2022.  He was an immediate success, before form shaded a tad, in particular when Ange Postecoglou varied midfield combinations. This season he has started all five competitive games, with performances eclipsing anything seen before.  He is still young with plenty [...]
articles.title: New contracts for some but not all

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS spent £18.25million in putting his Celtic jigsaw together for his second stint in charge of the champions. Coincidentally, the Irishman, just like his predecessor Ange Postecoglou the previous summer, brought in nine recruits. And, in an identical situation, the final player to arrive was a loan signing. Last season it was Oliver Abildgaard [...]
articles.title: SALES TALK (Part Two): BRENDAN’S £18.25m SPEND

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: ANGE POSTECOGLOU spent £20million in the 2022 summer market as he prepared for his second – and final – season as Celtic manager. The Greek-Australian gaffer brought in nine recruits with the last arrival being Danish international midfielder Oliver Abildgaard who signed a one-year loan deal from Rubin Kazan. The 6ft-plus enforcer joined his former [...]
articles.title: SALES TALK (Part One): ANGE’S £20m SPLASH

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CQN is turning the spotlight once again on the Celtic players who never had the honour of playing for their country. Andy Lynch may have been a trusted defender for Jock Stein, but never got the nod to get into a Scotland squad. The legendary Hoops manager thought he was buying a flying machine at [...]
articles.title: ANDY LYNCH: GREAT UNCAPPED CELTS (Part Three)

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: In a busy transfer window, Celtic signed nine new players and sold four from the first team squad.  Central defence saw two planned arrivals: Maik Nawrocki (22) and Gustaf Lagerbielke (23), and the departure of Carl Starfelt (28).  Starfelt’s two-year partnership with Cameron Carter-Vickers was remarkably successful.  They only once experience defeat in a domestic [...]
articles.title: Summer 23 Transfer Window assessment

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: THERE was speculation at the weekend that Kasper Schmeichel may emerge as a target for Brendan Rodgers. The link was that the Danish international, a free agent after being released by Nice, had played for the Irishman during their time together at Leicester City. CQN ignored the reports. Frankly, we didn’t believe them and saw [...]
articles.title: CELTIC: DEAL OR NO DEAL? THE HILARIOUS AND THE HYSTERICAL

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS reminded his Celtic players he knew how to win at Ibrox before Sunday’s confrontation. And the second time-around Hoops boss emphasised those words by sending out a determined bunch of Hoops stars who battled in front of a hostile 50,000 crowd to claim a 1-0 victory courtesy of a sensational volley from Kyogo [...]
articles.title: RODGERS 32 RANGERS 7

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CQN is turning the spotlight again on the Celtic players who never had the honour of playing for their country. articles.title: IAN YOUNG: GREAT UNCAPPED CELTS (Part Two)

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: If you can withhold pressure from the baying mob after poor football results, you are built from strong stuff. Looking in from the outside, it is easy to understand why sacking a manager should never be done on the back of one poor run of form, least of all a manager’s first poor run of [...]
articles.title: Football fans and fragile self-esteem

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: FORMER Celtic defender Charlie Mulgrew has brought his 18-year playing career to a halt. The 37-year-old one-time Scotland international has decided to quit after leaving his post as player-coach at relegated Dundee United in the summer. Mulgrew had two spells at Parkhead and played for eight clubs after originally coming through the Hoops’ youth system. [...]
articles.title: EX-CELT CALLS IT A DAY

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: LIAM SCALES is hoping to give Brendan Rodgers a selection headache in the months to come. The Irish centre-back answered his manager’s SOS call on Sunday when he took his place in the middle of the Celtic rearguard alongside new Bhoy Gustaf Lagerbiekle at Ibrox. In truth, that would not have been Rodgers’ pairing if [...]
articles.title: ‘I WILL GIVE HIM A HEADACHE,’ SCALES IN RODGERS TARGET

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: ALBIAN AJETI, Celtic’s £5million misfit marksman, has finally left the champions after nine goals for the club following his costly and disastrous arrival from West Ham in the summer of 2020. The big-money recruit, who spent last season on loan at Sturm Graz, has signed a permanent deal with Turkish club Gaziantep. The Swiss flop [...]
articles.title: FAREWELL TO CELTIC’S MISFIT MARKSMAN WHO COST MORE THAN £500,000-PER-GOAL
